title: LiteSXP64 Windows XP Professional x64 Edition
description:
for details on upcoming release check out
superior64. blogspot. com 


You might prefer the NEW FULL release over this one: https://thepiratebay.se/torrent/4945775


Much more has been removed in Superior XP64 Lite Edition. There is no Regional Settings prompt during installation. Some small improvements have been made regarding registry and installer. Other than that it's exactly the same as the full Superior XP64 release from April 2009.
This is not "warez", and no files are "cracked" in this OS. Original upload was done on ThePiratebay and Demonoid.


Please check this text prior to installing, so you know what to expect.


-> The system is set to CET and Euro usage. Only a few files for Keyboards,  internationalization and input-languages are available. See below for those that are NOT included. ***

-> Size did not fit on CD due to many included drivers, java, firefox and dot NET Framework (which is included for Manual installation later on)


This is a clean SECURE thoroughly tested A/V & IT-expert's version of XP
Professional x64 Edition retail SP2 English (United States, NT 5.2.3790.3959).
With inline *corporate* Volume License Key; this release passes
"Windows Genuine Advantage" checks, and a product key is NOT needed
(see \AMD64\WINNT.SIF on the iso). Have your own legal key? Please
change it using http://magicaljellybean.com/keyfinder/old.shtml

Windows XP x64 supports up to 128GB of RAM !
This Windows version is designed to work with 64-bit processors from AMD and
Intel that support the x64 extensions to the x86 architecture. These include
Athlon 64, Athlon 64 FX, Mobile Athlon 64, Turion 64, Opteron processors from
AMD, and all Xeon, Pentium 4, Dual, Quad & 8 Core Intel setups with EM64T.

Although this release is rather complete and sufficient for most users,
there is no Outlook Express in the core of this OS. This XP64 is intended
for those who - like me - prefer a Classic minimal approach, those who
prefer OpenOffice, do audio-/video-editing, creative and developing work,
and/or those who generally don't share their PC/laptop with other users.
This OS is not really for beginners. If you are one, at least make sure
your system is safe: https://www.xs4all.nl/en/veiligheid/checklist/
If you're the type that feels at home being Administrator *all the time*,
then this will be a Superior Windows OS for you!


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
INSTALL INSTRUCTIONS
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Burn the .iso Image-file to DVD at 6 X speed or slower (try http://ImgBurn.com )
Do not unpack the iso, just burn it directly, it's a boot-disc image.

IMPORTANT:
If you want to put SXP64 on a SSD, make sure you align the partition using this:
http://www.ocztechnologyforum.com/forum/showpost.php?p=326656&postcount=3
(Do this before you use the SXP64 install DVD..)

Power on your PC/laptop, press the button for the system to enter BIOS.
Change the Boot sequence to DVD first, then Save and Exit BIOS.
'Press any key' when asked to boot with the DVD and after about 6 minutes
you can (Quick)format the desired storage partition you want SXP64 to be on.
( You only need to boot from DVD once, don't press a key at the next boot ! )

-> Don't take out your DVD before installation is finished. Give the computer
   sufficient time to decide what it must do, a good setup takes some time.

-> Don't use this DVD to  Repair  or  Upgrade  existing copies of Windows.

SHA1 of LiteSXP64.iso:  f7f47339cc10840055c8e72543c4d1d366a6c905
( you can use http://www.slavasoft.com/hashcalc to check this )



--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Is this version of XP really "Superior" ?
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
When you buy XP x64 Edition from Microsoft you'll get a rather old CD. So you
go to the Windows Update website and find out you need to update your system
with hundreds of patches, new drivers and so on. This update-process creates a
lot of extra slack on your harddisk, backups of previous versions of numerous
system-files and drivers, and roll-back options you'll never use remain there.
Superior XP (SXP64) already has the latest versions of system-files built-IN,
ALL official XP x64 updates released until April 23 2009 are fully integrated!
Some parts of the original Microsoft Windows XP Professional x64 Edition were
bound to go wrong for most users, or were never being used, so these facts have
been considered creating SXP64, causing the removal of many files and updating
of the registry. All is improved in so many ways that it warranted a freshly
created install image to get better speeds and a more reliable daily workflow.
If your CPU and motherboard support x64 (64 bit), then this might
very well be the fastest Desktop/Workstation system you can find!

What also makes this install-image superior is the fact that many storage media
controller drivers are already in there. This means you can install this OS
directly on new S-ATA/AHCI/RAID and SSD hardware without trouble or errors.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ADDED ITEMS & FEATURES
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I n t e g r a t e d  (pre-installed) into this XP64 release :

- Mozilla Firefox 3.0.9, with pre-installed add-ons:
  * ConfigMania https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/4420
  * AdBlockPlus (asks for a filter-choice at first start)
   
- Flash-player
- Shockwave
- Sun Java JRE 6u13 i586 and x64

- Internet Explorer 6 (plus all security updates and settings I prefer)

- Windows Media Player 11
  plus IE6 and Firefox plugins, extra smooth/safe with tweaks.

- Quicktime Lite 2.80

- PSPad (4/13/2009) -> Brilliant freeware Text Editor, replacing Notepad.
                       Better than Editpad, textpad, notepad2 or notepad++
                     ( notepad.exe is still there, under folder \Base\ )

- Total Commander 7.04a (king of filemanagers, with 7zip and iso-mount plugins)

- JKDefrag64 (replaces the Disk Defragmentation tool from MS)

- ERUNT -> Auto-backups state of registry, this crucial tool in essence
  replaces System Restore, and works a LOT better! Info on using ERUNT:
 <a href=" http://www.larshederer.homepage.t-online.de/erunt/erunt.txt" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.larshederer.homepage.t-online.de/erunt/erunt.txt</a>

- Autoruns (right-click My Computer) -> Much better than using MSConfig

- PuTTy -> 64 bit SSH client, replacing telnet and hyperterminal.

- DirectX 9.26.1590 (64 bit & 32 bit)
  Note that DirectX 10 for XP64 (plus a 9-10 Switcher tool)
  can be found via the \Superior\ folder on your Desktop !

- Some gorgeous unique Desktop Wallpapers included.

- Useful extra Fonts and Cursors!
  I really LOVE these effective and lightweight cursors. And I work with this
  font-set because these are the ones I prefer, and I've seen too many system-
  fonts not to know what's best for me. I also think the desktop background is
  really cool and warm and has depth. I don't want fancy-ass useless bullshit on
  my screen, I need my machines to work for me, deliver quality and save time,
  not be paintings on the wall. So, if you still think I could give a rats ass
  about your taste, please design your own OS. Let's see how awfully ugly your
  preferences will be. I suspect they'll be heavy and non-productive, like most.

- Commandline stuff available in this OS, among others:
  arp.exe, at.exe, atsvc.exe, fc.exe, find.exe, findstr.exe, ftp.exe,
  ipconfig.exe, logoff.exe, net.exe, nbtstat.exe, netsh.exe, netshell.exe,
  netstat.exe, nslookup.exe, ntrights.exe, pathping.exe, ping.exe, posix.exe,
  rcp.exe, replace.exe, secfixup.exe, subst.exe, syskey.exe, taskkill.exe,
  tskill.exe, xcopy.exe, tracert.exe, tracert6.exe, shutdown.exe, where.exe


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
D R I V E R S
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Integrated:

NVIDIA Forceware 182.50 WHQL XP 64 (all known NV GT videocards supported),
the latest Intel, Realtek and Broadcom ethernet drivers,
Gigabyte and many Intel chipsets/boards essentials.

TEXTMODE S-ATA/AHCI/RAID drivers;

Nvidia SATAIDE Driver (v10.3.0.42) WHQL
Nvidia SATARAID Driver (v10.3.0.42) WHQL
JMicron JMB36X RAID Processor (latest!)
All Intel(R) SATA AHCI RAID Controllers (Version 8.8.0.1009)

Except for Windows core drivers and Realtek Media,
NO extra audio-chipset drivers are integrated !

Some drivers, BUT NOT ALL, are included and compatible hardware is checked
during installation. Only drivers for your hardware will be installed.

Still missing drivers?

Try http://opendrivers.com and http://filehippo.com/ or ask the manufacturer
of your hardware brand about XP x64 drivers. They should supply them.
Any driver available for Windows XP Professional x64 Edition works in SXP64.
In most cases Windows 2003 x64 (server) software will work in SXP64 as well.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
E X C L U D E D
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    - Internet Explorer 7 or 8
    - Windows Search 4.0 (don't know anyone who uses it..)
    - MS Silverlight (pfff..)

- Windows File Protection = DISABLED, but security catalogs still in tact!

- Indexing Service = Disabled.
  This Windows x64 release is targeted for use with SSD (NAND/Flash) storage;
  Indexing, Defragmenting and many other disk-polling aspects not recommended.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

( Check "Last Session.ini" in \sxp64\ folder for the actual nLite preset.. )


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
AFTER INSTALLATION
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-> Windows Sounds have been removed. The Sound-scheme is still set to it though, change this to no sounds or your own sounds..

-> You might need the All-In-One .NET Framework install - 2.0/3.0 SP2 + 3.5 SP1
   which is on the DVD/iso under folder \dot.NET\
   Simply double-click the .bat file in that folder and installation follows!

-> Check the folder "Superior" on your desktop for lots of handy stuff.

-> Remember to change the Administrator password some time in the near future!

-> Commit Charge (Memory footprint) right after installation is ~120 MB,
   with 19 processes running. This includes DirectX alive & kicking !

There is a HUGE worldwide userbase supporting XP Pro x64 Edition,
for further updating, maintenance and advice, do check out these: <a href="

It turns out that a wide range of known applications, like those for Audio-
and Video- editing, encoding, mixing, muxing, BluRay/HD viewing and production,
as well as many scientific and no-nonsense apps used by media-professionals
and experts, in general, often perform faster and more efficient in XP64
than they do in Vista or Windows 7. So:  Why isn't XP x64 better known?


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MISC
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

- This OS has many sophisticated registered tweaks applied. View the file
  "X64_2009.REG" in "/Base/" on your system disk for details.
  Or go to http://paste2.org/p/193177

- Max Half-open Connections limit for TCP has been raised to 8192.

- UXTheme.dll has been patched, you can install any theme you want.

- Hibernate = disabled, but still usable.


This SuperiorXP64 OS auto-logs on with:

  username:  Administrator
  password:  april2009


Enjoy!


~YourSuperior
